alert.note: Alert for Coke; Runnels; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 6:37PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Coke, northeastern Tom Green and Runnels Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 637 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Orient, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ballinger, Winters, Maverick, Bronte, Miles, Orient, Norton, Benoit, Hatchel, Crews, Tennyson, Rowena, Grape Creek, The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662, Lake Winters Lake, Ballinger Lake, Harriet and Us-83 Near The Concho-Runnels County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
